job_history.work_description: Provided application and network support services for the MSBA. Maintained a rackspace hosted asp.net solution tied to SQL Server. Refreshed hardware and software, and brought the development group up to sql server, tfs, and VS 2012. Rewrote utility and security library from VB.NET to C#. Developed an architecture based on object modeling for a middle tier. Served as project manager for all current projects and provided business analysis to work out business workflows for the team. Recommended Tableau as the authority's visualization business intelligence tool.

Lead clinical and research programming development and application support for applications developed by the group for the Cardiovascular Program. Project managed the effort to replace a number of legacy systems with modern C# applications. Maintained professional and clinical billing for the cardiology department. Developed and maintained research applications for the cardiology's research department. Served as the logical Oracle DBA who puts objects into production and maintained the central job scheduler.

Provided network, application and help desk support for the largest agency in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, The Department of Mental Retardation. Upgraded to Zen 5.0 of Novell and remotely managed desktops. Developed client server model applications and the electronic service delivery model which was hosted in the facility with ITD's assistance.

Provided application development and support services to the Department of Youth Services. Led the Year 2000 project to convert the Natural/Adabas mainframe system to a ASP web based application YSIS. Served as a banyan administrator to the Network Administrator.

education.university: Suffolk University - Sawyer School of Management
